name: Faking history
description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

key_work.title: The Great season two costume: Catherine’s war dress
key_work.credit_line: Courtesy of MRC II Distribution Company, L.P.
key_work.brief_description:
This stunning war dress hints at the harder side of Catherine in season two of The Great. The profile is still flattering and feminine, with the cream bodice and skirt reflecting her bright, innocent colour palette of the first season, but there’s something new here too: unique embroideries by Cathryn Avison that add a splash of ominous but striking oxblood red to the dress.

This isn’t the first time Avyson has embroidered a dress for Elle Fanning – she also hand embroidered the blue dress Fanning wears as Princess Aurora in Maleficient: Mistress of Evil.

Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

start.title: Call of Duty
start.brief_description: Call of Duty is a first-person shooter video game franchise published by Activision. Starting out in 2003, it first focused on games set in World War II. Over time, the series has moved to the Cold War, futuristic worlds and outer space.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

end.title: Titanic
end.creator_credit: James Cameron, Deborah Lynn Scott, Jon Landau, 20th Century Fox, Lightstorm Entertainment, Paramount, Peter Lamont and John Bruno
end.brief_description: 101-year-old Rose DeWitt Bukater tells the story of her life aboard the Titanic, 84 years later. A young Rose boards the ship with her mother and fiancé. Meanwhile, Jack Dawson and Fabrizio De Rossi win third-class tickets aboard the ship. Rose tells the whole story from Titanic’s departure through to its death—on its first and last voyage—on April 15, 1912.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

constellations_other.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_other.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

constellations_other.name: Quiet luxury, loud transformations
constellations_other.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

links.description: Other historical epics have used fiction to illustrate the humanity in major historical moments. In Titanic the doomed romance between Jack and Rose plays out amidst a cast of historical figures; Fifth Officer Harold Lowe, who rescues Rose, was a real officer on the Titanic.

start.title: The Great season two costume: Catherine’s war dress

end.title: Jojo Rabbit
end.creator_credit: Carthew Neal, Chelsea Winstanley and Taika Waititi
end.headline_credit: Czech Republic, New Zealand and United States of America, 2019
end.brief_description: A World War II satire that follows a lonely German boy whose world view is turned upside down when he discovers his single mother is hiding a young Jewish girl in their attic. Aided only by his idiotic imaginary friend, Adolf Hitler, Jojo must confront his blind nationalism.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

constellations_other.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_other.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

links.description: Like The Great, Taika Waititi’s Jojo Rabbit plays up its fictional elements for laughs. Through this dark comedy, Waititi explores the idea that “good” people can do terrible things, if they don’t learn to think for themselves.

end.credit_line:
Charli XCX & Troye Sivan

Creative Direction: WP&A

Executive Producer: Ryen Bartlett

Warner Music Group
end.brief_description:
The official music video for Charli XCX & Troye Sivan - “1999”.

Taken from the third studio album Charli, released in 2019. Charli featured the singles “1999”, “Blame It On Your Love”, “Gone” and “White Mercedes.”

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

links.description: Charli XCX & Troye Sivan appear in iconic 90s moments in the “1999” music video, including Titanic. Though Sivan was only four, fantasy is the point: “I know those days are over / but a boy can fantasise / ‘Bout JTT on MTV,” Sivan sings.

start.title: Jojo Rabbit
start.creator_credit: Carthew Neal, Chelsea Winstanley and Taika Waititi
start.headline_credit: Czech Republic, New Zealand and United States of America, 2019
start.brief_description: A World War II satire that follows a lonely German boy whose world view is turned upside down when he discovers his single mother is hiding a young Jewish girl in their attic. Aided only by his idiotic imaginary friend, Adolf Hitler, Jojo must confront his blind nationalism.

end.title: Call of Duty
end.brief_description: Call of Duty is a first-person shooter video game franchise published by Activision. Starting out in 2003, it first focused on games set in World War II. Over time, the series has moved to the Cold War, futuristic worlds and outer space.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

links.description: While Jojo Rabbit rewrote history for satire, other unhistorical narratives could have darker motives. The Call of Duty series have been criticised for promoting Western imperialism, rewriting events to make the US look unequivocally like heroes. Call of Duty: Vanguard (2021), made in Melbourne, is the latest game in the almost two-decade-old series.

start.title: Call of Duty
start.brief_description: Call of Duty is a first-person shooter video game franchise published by Activision. Starting out in 2003, it first focused on games set in World War II. Over time, the series has moved to the Cold War, futuristic worlds and outer space.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

end.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018) Mrs Hester Appleyard's fete costume (purple)
end.brief_description: In Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018), Mrs Appleyard (Natalie Dormer) projects an image of rigidity, structure and control. This is reflected in her ornate sense of dress. Here, you can see the underpinnings that contribute to the silhouette of this highly structured garment – a separated skirt and jacket that are given shape by a generous bustle and a cinched corset. In stark contrast to the soft, airy shapes and natural fabrics of the picnic dresses that the young students wear, Mrs Appleyard’s costumes communicate one thing: control.

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

links.description: Blending fact and fiction can also be a practical concern. Costume designer Edie Kurzer used a mix of vintage fabric and garments with new designs for miniseries Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018). Mrs Appleyard’s purple fete dress is one of the only garments made for the series from scratch

links.description: Historical gowns like those in Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018) are showstopping when done right. Costumes from Titanic (1997) are so popular they have a dedicated museum - the Titanic Museum Attraction, in Pigeon Forge, Tennessee.
